summary: This document is an email chain from August 13-14, 2019, arranging a visit by DOJ officials to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York to inspect the facility, including the area where Jeffrey Epstein was held and his cell, which was still cordoned off following his death. The visit was to be escorted only by MCC legal staff, with instructions not to speak to guards due to ongoing investigations.

keyFacts: DOJ officials planned a visit to the MCC on August 15, 2019, to inspect the facility following Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The specific areas to be toured included the 2nd floor psych observation and suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Epstein's cell, which was noted as still being cordoned off.
The visit was to be escorted only by MCC legal staff, with explicit instructions that officials would not speak to any guards present due to ongoing investigations.
The email chain shows coordination between high-level DOJ/SDNY officials and MCC staff, indicating the sensitivity and priority of the post-death investigation.
A request was made for the new acting warden to join the tour, suggesting a focus on current leadership and procedures at the facility.
